sentences.sContent: Almost nothing was done to improve the situation.
sentences.sCn: 几乎没有采取什么措施来改善这个情况。

sentences.sContent: The story is almost certainly true.
sentences.sCn: 这故事几乎肯定是真实的。

sentences.sContent: He’s almost as old as I am.
...The phrase almost completes itself: midlife crisis...
...almost three in five people say they try to limit their usage of paper—including facial tissue and kitchen roll―to save money...
...there is almost no hard evidence for midlife crisis other than a few small pilot studies conducted decades ago...
...almost all of us will experience a period of radical professional change...
...he came home from school almost in tears...
...A handful of people can recall almost every day of their lives in enormous detail—and after years of research...
...People would come in out of a formal and almost Victorian attitude...
...A very small number of people are able to remember almost every detail of their life...

trans.tranOther: nearly, but not completely or not quite
